apis.description:
Depending on the URL given, return either (1) all of the enrollments in
a course, (2) all of the enrollments in a section or (3) all of a user's
enrollments. This includes student, teacher, TA, and observer enrollments.

If a user has multiple enrollments in a context (e.g. as a teacher
and a student or in multiple course sections), each enrollment will be
listed separately.

note: Currently, only an admin user can return other users' enrollments. A
user can, however, return his/her own enrollments.

operations.notes:
Depending on the URL given, return either (1) all of the enrollments in
a course, (2) all of the enrollments in a section or (3) all of a user's
enrollments. This includes student, teacher, TA, and observer enrollments.

If a user has multiple enrollments in a context (e.g. as a teacher
and a student or in multiple course sections), each enrollment will be
listed separately.

note: Currently, only an admin user can return other users' enrollments. A
user can, however, return his/her own enrollments.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A list of enrollment types to return. Accepted values are 'StudentEnrollment', 'TeacherEnrollment', 'TaEnrollment', 'DesignerEnrollment', and 'ObserverEnrollment.' If omitted, all enrollment types are returned. This argument is ignored if `role` is given.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: A list of enrollment roles to return. Accepted values include course-level roles created by the {api:RoleOverridesController#add_role Add Role API} as well as the base enrollment types accepted by the `type` argument above.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by enrollment state. If omitted, 'active' and 'invited' enrollments are returned.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A list of enrollment types to return. Accepted values are 'StudentEnrollment', 'TeacherEnrollment', 'TaEnrollment', 'DesignerEnrollment', and 'ObserverEnrollment.' If omitted, all enrollment types are returned. This argument is ignored if `role` is given.

apis.description: Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.

operations.notes: Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: enrollment[user_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the user to be enrolled in the course.

parameters.name: enrollment[type]
parameters.description: Enroll the user as a student, teacher, TA, observer, or designer. If no value is given, the type will be inferred by enrollment[role] if supplied, otherwise 'StudentEnrollment' will be used.

parameters.name: enrollment[role]
parameters.description: Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.

parameters.name: enrollment[enrollment_state]
parameters.description: If set to 'active,' student will be immediately enrolled in the course. Otherwise they will be required to accept a course invitation. Default is 'invited.'

parameters.name: enrollment[course_section_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the course section to enroll the student in. If the section-specific URL is used, this argument is redundant and will be ignored.

parameters.name: enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section]
parameters.description: If a teacher or TA enrollment, teacher/TA will be restricted to the section given by course_section_id.

parameters.name: enrollment[notify]
parameters.description: If true, a notification will be sent to the enrolled user. Notifications are not sent by default.

parameters.name: enrollment[self_enrollment_code]
parameters.description: If the current user is not allowed to manage enrollments in this course, but the course allows self-enrollment, the user can self- enroll as a student in the default section by passing in a valid code. When self-enrolling, the user_id must be 'self'. The enrollment_state will be set to 'active' and all other arguments will be ignored.

apis.description: Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.

operations.notes: Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.

parameters.name: section_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: enrollment[user_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the user to be enrolled in the course.

parameters.name: enrollment[type]
parameters.description: Enroll the user as a student, teacher, TA, observer, or designer. If no value is given, the type will be inferred by enrollment[role] if supplied, otherwise 'StudentEnrollment' will be used.

parameters.name: enrollment[role]
parameters.description: Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.

parameters.name: enrollment[enrollment_state]
parameters.description: If set to 'active,' student will be immediately enrolled in the course. Otherwise they will be required to accept a course invitation. Default is 'invited.'

parameters.name: enrollment[course_section_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the course section to enroll the student in. If the section-specific URL is used, this argument is redundant and will be ignored.

parameters.name: enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section]
parameters.description: If a teacher or TA enrollment, teacher/TA will be restricted to the section given by course_section_id.

parameters.name: enrollment[notify]
parameters.description: If true, a notification will be sent to the enrolled user. Notifications are not sent by default.

parameters.name: enrollment[self_enrollment_code]
parameters.description: If the current user is not allowed to manage enrollments in this course, but the course allows self-enrollment, the user can self- enroll as a student in the default section by passing in a valid code. When self-enrolling, the user_id must be 'self'. The enrollment_state will be set to 'active' and all other arguments will be ignored.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: The action to take on the enrollment.
